author: thealexanderheller
title: Chilean Leprechaun Video Campaign
description: To bring more entrepreneurs and new talent to the participate in the Catalyst ecosystem!

assessments.note: I get the idea of creating videos, but according to the example, a large part of it is entertainment, and then education. I doubt it will attract a large number of proposers, and I doubt even more that these proposers will be qualified. The target group of these videos would be very young people (IMO) thus, I do not believe in this idea. Also, the budget feels overextended -  40k USD.

The official IOG marketing campaigns present the Cardano/Catalyst ecosystem as a serious, peer-reviewed one, that wishes to attract talented entrepreneurs. A series of video content would certainly achieve that, yet that type of content should have a similar direction with the official campaigns, otherwise the attracted people might not be the one it aims for. The proposal doesn't make it clear what the content will be, there is no general script, not even a general topic of the videos that would help the community determine if they would vote for it.

Video is an engaging format for marketing. For finding potential proposers, there may be more targeted ways of distribution than blasting through all platforms (it is not 100% like advertising for a consumer product).
It is not clear how this project will reach proposers

The use of comedy videos for attracting proposers to Catalyst is not ideal. The audio visuals of IOHK and Catalyst town halls get substantial coverage and will get the required result once Smart contracts are in place.

Catchy videos are good for a broader audience! I think this will have a positive impact for proposers outreach for 2 reasons:
* Spreads the word about cardano, thus more people may get involved directly in Catalyst
* More people will learn about Cardano and this will help proposals in other challenges since target audience for such proposals will already be familiar with the Cardano ecosystem.

This proposal can make the IdeaScale project more popular among crypto community, as the submitters look like real professionals, but that appears to be a pure marketing campaign, without any technological aspect and as I can see now, IdeaScale becomes more popular from day to day by itself

I think they would be able to deliver the product - video - but their outreach (85k followers on tiktok) - it is not much imo. So I do not think that the outcome would be that large, as they expect, but they would be able to deliver such videos.

The team behind the proposal seem to have experience in creating a certain type of video content that has the potential to become viral. Yet the proposal describes the production of 5-10 videos, which is quite a big difference. Will there be 5 videos, or double, 10? It is hard to estimate it the allocated time and budget are appropriate if the number of videos they wish to produce is not known.
The team seem to be professional and experienced. They have established history of delivery on their works.
The experience seems in line with the proposal made, and previous works seems of quality. The plan is detailed enough with milestones and timelines

The proposers have demonstrated the capability to produce videos that get the required traction in social media. With this talent and dedication, the team is likely to produce quality content as claimed.
team is experienced with good portfolio and the plan of implementation is described, but also it could be good to have ane demos on each stage, which is not mentioned.

I could not find metrics on how to measure it. Maybe the increase of followers? A number of likes?  Still, it would provide no value and we could not confirm the relation between the number of ideas and this project.

The team presents itself as being talented, however the proposal doesn't provide enough detailed information regarding the content of the videos, only a promise that they will be funny and viral. There is also no detailed budget, not even a mention on how much will be spent on ads and how much on content creation.

The provided plan is very detailed and realistic. The team should be able to catch the attention of many eyes. The conversion rate may be not as high as usual consumer goods due to the nature that we are looking for proposers.

The case has not been made how a general viral  comedy targeted at Chile using 40% of this funds capital will make a significant increase in global proposals from outside the Cardano community. More information should be provided on how the campaign will target proposers.
I would like to see a partitioned budget, but otherwise the plan seems solid, the amount of work defined and the objective clear.

Reaching out to proposers by information videos is a novel idea. There is a substantial reach for funny/comedy videos. However, the effectiveness in attracting serious proposers outside the blockchain industry with capability by this kind of video may not be great.
proposal provides enough information how it show be done and it is really feasible with potential growth of Cardano and IdeaScale community, but it is only one-time campaign

solution: We will create a series of video advertisements/engaging pieces of content to generate interest among new eyes! Catalyst is for everyone!
experience: My team and I have ran a video business for the past 7 years and we also are digital marketers certified on FB and Google!
